title: Linker barfs on file with no ending newline
body:
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull -u" and retry what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. 6g short.go (attached)
2. 6l short.6
3.

What is the expected output?
6.out

What do you see instead?
main.main: instruction with linenumber past EOF in /tmp/foo.go: (9)	ADDQ	$64,SP
main.main: instruction with linenumber past EOF in /tmp/foo.go: (9)	RET	,
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>:
(9)	TEXT	main.init+0(SB),$0
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	MOVQ	-16(FS),CX
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	CMPQ	SP,(CX)
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	JHI	,4008a7
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>:
(9)	CALL	,405cc3+runtime.morestack00
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>:
(9)	MOVB	main.initdone路+0(SB),AL
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	MOVB	AL,BL
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	CMPB	BL,$0
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	JEQ	,4008c2
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	MOVB	AL,BL
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	CMPB	BL,$2
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	JNE	,4008bd
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	RET	,
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>:
(9)	CALL	,400a9c+runtime.throwinit
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>:
(9)	MOVB	$1,main.initdone路+0(SB)
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>:
(9)	CALL	,418311+fmt.Init路
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>:
(9)	MOVB	$2,main.initdone路+0(SB)
main.init: instruction with linenumber past EOF in <nil>: (9)	RET	,


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g/l (note I could not reproduce the problem on 8g/l)

Which operating system are you using?
linux

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
d61ee475bdf5+ tip

Please provide any additional information below.
short.go should have no newline at the end.  To verify this (that, e.g. your editor
hasn't inserted one), cat short.go, and make sure that "} /* NO NEWLINE */"
shows up on the same line as your shell prompt.
Attachments: 1. short.go (81 bytes)
